interestingFact: There are 195 countries in the world today, including 193 United Nations member states and 2 observer states.
Nepal is home to Mount Everest, the tallest mountain in the world, standing at 8,848 meters.
The Pyramids of Giza are one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World.
Australia is home to the Great Barrier Reef, the largest coral reef system in the world.
Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest, the largest tropical rainforest in the world.
The Eiffel Tower in Paris was once the tallest man-made structure in the world.
Russia is the largest country in the world by area, covering more than 17 million square kilometers.
The Great Wall of China stretches over 21,000 kilometers.
India is the birthplace of four major world religions: Hinduism, Buddhism, Jainism, and Sikhism.
Japan is made up of over 6,800 islands.
Germany is home to the world's largest beer festival, Oktoberfest.
The United States is the third most populous country in the world.
The UK is made up of four countries: England, Scotland, Wales, and Northern Ireland.
Rome is home to Vatican City, the smallest independent state in the world.
Canada has more lakes than the rest of the world's lakes combined.
South Africa has three capital cities: Pretoria, Cape Town, and Bloemfontein.
Mexico introduced chocolate, corn, and chili peppers to the world.
Saudi Arabia is home to Mecca, the holiest city in Islam.
Argentina is famous for tango music and dance.
South Korea is one of the most technologically advanced countries in the world.
